definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to express a wish (to a deity)

sentences.english: Some hotel chains are already pledging to keep their properties a little more germ-free.
sentences.chinese: 一些连锁酒店已经许下保持环境无菌的承诺。

sentences.english: II） I am not so foolish as to make such a promise.
sentences.chinese: 我还没有愚蠢到会许下这样的承诺的地步。

sentences.english: Have thought of and you have a section of the Oath, he thought you promised.
sentences.chinese: 曾想过和你拥有一段誓言，曾想过为你许下承诺。

sentences.english: My boots are modest. They make no promise they can't keep.
sentences.chinese: 我的胶靴很谦逊，不会许下无法兑现的诺言。

sentences.english: This is the promise we made when Medicare was born.
sentences.chinese: 这是医疗保险诞生之初我们许下的诺言。

sentences.english: He's made good on all of his promises.
sentences.chinese: 他实现了所有曾经许下的诺言。

sentences.english: Now that I have made a promise to you, I would do just as what l said. I will never break my words.
sentences.chinese: 既然我已经对你许下承诺，那我就会按我说过的来做。

sentences.english: They go to the Chapel of Love to be married.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到爱之殿堂许下神圣的婚姻诺言。

sentences.english: Liu to the promise which small promised colorfully already cashed before Washington.
sentences.chinese: 刘朝华生前对小艳许下的诺言已经兑现了。

sentences.english: Lindens, silently you make his own desire.
sentences.chinese: 菩提树下，默默的为你许下自己的心愿。

sentences.english: I do not easily give any promise, once made, will do.
sentences.chinese: 我不等闲给任何人诺言，一旦许下，就一定会做到。

sentences.english: Moving forward, Bialik already has big hopes for 2013.
sentences.chinese: 谈到2013年，“艾米”已经许下了愿望。

sentences.english: But we made a commitment to protect sharks.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们许下了承诺要保护鲨鱼。

sentences.english: Look, I can't break my promise to her then.
sentences.chinese: 听听看，我怎能违背当初我许下的诺言。

sentences.english: The promise David spoke on our honeymoon had been fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 戴维在蜜月时许下的承诺已经实现了。

definition: to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
to pray/to pray for sth/to wish sth/prayer/wish
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
